text.p: NARODNA OBRODA - A branch of engineering concern Povazske Strojarne a.s., arms maker 07-Povzbroj, plans to invite an unspecified foreign partner, after it is transformed into a daughter company of Holding Povazske Strojarne later this year. The state should continue to hold a 25-35 percent stake in the firm.

- Slovak authorities, in accordance with the government manifesto, are not considering any plan of future possible neutrality for Slovakia, if the country drops out of the first round of NATO enlargement, Foreign Minister Pavol Hamzik said.

- The Defence Ministry rejected last week's news of the Russian ITAR-TASS news agency, according to which Slovakia will buy six military helicopters from Russia. The ministry is considering such a purchase, but so far no decision has been made neither on the type of helicopters nor from where, the statement said.

SME - Electrical monopoly Slovenske Elektrarne a.s. proposes a 50-percent increase in energy prices for individuals and a 15 percent for industrial customers. However, the company expects this proposal to be revised by the Finance Ministry.

PRAVDA - Slovakia posted a $104.3 million trade surplus with Germany for the first two months of the year. Imports from Germany totalled to $252.2 million, while Slovakia exported goods worth $356.5 million.

HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - The second largest commercial bank, IRB a.s., called an annual shareholders meeting for May 21, to approve the bank's results for 1996. The AGM is also expected to approve some bond issues for the period of 1997-1998.
